title: JavaScript Arrays
subject: JavaScript
theory:
An array is a special variable, which can hold more than one value.

Arrays are zero-indexed: the first element is at index 0.

They create ordered lists of data.

examples.explanation: `push` adds an element to the end of the array.

common_mistakes.correction: Arrays use numbered indexes. Objects use named keys.

interview_questions.question: How do you remove the first element of an array?
How do you check if variable is an array?

practice_problems.problem: Create an array of 3 numbers and print the last one.

real_world_use_cases.description: Product lists, Todo items, User lists are all stored as Arrays.

exam_notes: Arrays are technically Objects in JS `typeof [] === 'object'`.
summary: Arrays are the primary data structure for lists. You will use them constantly.
